intro: Rhynchosia orthodanum, commonly known as the African morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in the morning, hence its common name. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks. Rhynchosia orthodanum is also known for its medicinal properties, used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
